Description: Resistance to check point inhibitors (CPI) have been a major impediment to expanding the therapeutic benefit to majority of cancer patients.  It has been found that T cell priming status is a crucial factor in determining the sensitivity for CPI activity.  Proper priming of CD8 T-cells is a fundamental strategy for reversing resistance to CPI.  Accordingly, sequencing of immunotherapy is crucial for the success of such therapy.  Radiation therapy functions as an in-situ priming agent and immune-modulator and hence can be used to enhance the effect or reverse the resistance to immunotherapy and the sequencing of such approach is paramount
Location: New Orleans Theater A, Convention Center

Title: Radiation Sequencing and Immunotherapy
